author: mklement0
body:
Note: Only `Get-Item` is affect, not also `Get-ChildItem`, and only on _Windows_.

# Steps to reproduce

Run the following on _Windows_:

```powershell
{ Get-Item -ea stop Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\FileSystem::\ } | should -not -throw
{ Get-Item -ea stop Microsoft.PowerShell.Core\FileSystem::/ } | should -not -throw
```

# Expected behavior

Both tests should pass.

# Actual behavior

Both tests fail:

```none
"Could not find item /."
```

As stated, these tests work fine on Unix, and on Windows also if you replace `Get-Item` with `Get-ChildItem`.

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-rc.2
```
title: Get-Item: "\" and "/" aren't recognized as root paths when used with the provider prefix on Windows
